data: 1 00:00:05,005 --> 00:00:12,005 Encoded By "Pirata-Tuga" ...TuGAZx,Enjoy! 2 00:01:53,112 --> 00:01:54,947 Bingo! 3 00:01:55,781 --> 00:01:57,992 (chimps screeching) 4 00:02:09,253 --> 00:02:11,130 Fucking hell. 5 00:02:11,214 --> 00:02:12,840 (screech) 6 00:02:13,382 --> 00:02:15,343 Fucking hell. 7 00:03:05,476 --> 00:03:08,145 - Oh, God... - Keep your shit together. 8 00:03:08,229 --> 00:03:11,315 If you wanna get 'em out of here. 9 00:03:12,149 --> 00:03:14,819 - I can pop these, no problem. - So get to it! 10 00:03:29,041 --> 00:03:31,544 Security, we have a break-in. Get the... 11 00:03:40,011 --> 00:03:42,847 I know who you are. I know what you think... 12 00:03:42,930 --> 00:03:46,767 If you don't wanna get hurt, keep your mouth shut and don't move. 13 00:03:46,851 --> 00:03:52,106 The chimps are infected. They're highly contagious. They've been given an inhibitor. 14 00:03:52,190 --> 00:03:55,651 - Infected with what? - To cure, you must first understand. 15 00:03:55,735 --> 00:03:58,696 Infected with what? 16 00:04:00,656 --> 00:04:02,533 Rage. 17 00:04:04,243 --> 00:04:07,413 - What is he talking about? - Get the cages open. 18 00:04:07,496 --> 00:04:08,831 No! No! No! 19 00:04:09,540 --> 00:04:13,836 Listen, you sick bastard, we're taking your torture victims with us. 20 00:04:13,920 --> 00:04:15,505 We'll get you out of here. 21 00:04:15,588 --> 00:04:20,259 The animals are contagious. The infection is in their blood and saliva. One bite... 22 00:04:20,343 --> 00:04:22,845 Stop... Stop! You've no idea! 23 00:04:25,431 --> 00:04:27,308 (screaming) 24 00:04:29,393 --> 00:04:32,230 Get it off! Help me! 25 00:04:37,610 --> 00:04:39,737 Get it off! Get it off! 26 00:04:43,366 --> 00:04:46,577 - What's the matter with her? - You have to kill her! 27 00:04:48,663 --> 00:04:50,915 (screams) Oh, my God! 28 00:04:55,253 --> 00:04:58,464 - What's the matter with her? - We have to kill her now! 29 00:05:00,967 --> 00:05:02,552 Oh, God... 30 00:05:03,094 --> 00:05:04,136 (screaming) 31 00:05:41,007 --> 00:05:43,009 (sharp intake of breath) 32 00:06:51,536 --> 00:06:53,037 Hello? 33 00:07:10,137 --> 00:07:11,472 (coughs) 34 00:07:31,492 --> 00:07:32,994 Hello? 35 00:07:51,137 --> 00:07:53,139 (louder) Hello! 36 00:08:24,170 --> 00:08:25,254 (belches) 37 00:09:35,074 --> 00:09:36,409 Hello? 38 00:10:02,727 --> 00:10:04,228 Hello! 39 00:11:59,260 --> 00:12:01,262 (alarm) 40 00:14:56,562 --> 00:14:58,648 Hello? 41 00:15:06,656 --> 00:15:08,741 Hello? 42 00:15:10,576 --> 00:15:13,079 (noises from behind door) 43 00:15:19,210 --> 00:15:21,587 (gasping and retching) 44 00:15:23,089 --> 00:15:25,174 Father? 45 00:15:31,597 --> 00:15:33,683 Father, are you OK? 46 00:15:41,023 --> 00:15:43,693 Oh, shouldn't have done that. 47 00:15:44,110 --> 00:15:46,362 Shouldn't have done that. 48 00:15:46,779 --> 00:15:48,656 Shit! 49 00:16:15,433 --> 00:16:17,560 (man) Over here! 50 00:16:20,438 --> 00:16:22,773 - Over here! - Come on! 51 00:16:35,244 --> 00:16:37,705 Go, go, go! 52 00:16:42,960 --> 00:16:44,045 Keep going! 53 00:16:44,128 --> 00:16:47,006 - What the fuck is going on? - Just shut up! 54 00:16:55,139 --> 00:16:57,725 - Covered everything. - Who are those people? 55 00:17:25,044 --> 00:17:26,295 Let's go! Let's go! 56 00:17:26,379 --> 00:17:28,631 - What the fuck is going on? - Just move! 57 00:17:37,431 --> 00:17:39,433 Come on! 58 00:17:58,619 --> 00:18:03,374 Man walks into a bar with a giraffe. They each get pissed. 59 00:18:03,457 --> 00:18:05,459 The giraffe falls over. 60 00:18:05,543 --> 00:18:10,756 The man goes to leave and the barman says "Oi! You can't leave that lying there." 61 00:18:10,840 --> 00:18:14,886 He says "No, it's not a lion. It's a giraffe". 62 00:18:22,518 --> 00:18:25,396 He's completely humourless. 63 00:18:25,479 --> 00:18:28,399 You two should get on like a house on fire. 64 00:18:29,901 --> 00:18:31,986 So who are you? 65 00:18:33,196 --> 00:18:35,114 You're from the hospital. 66 00:18:35,198 --> 00:18:38,701 - Are you a doctor? - He's not a doctor. He's a patient. 67 00:18:38,784 --> 00:18:41,120 I'm a bicycle courier. 68 00:18:43,289 --> 00:18:49,712 I was riding a package from Farringdon to Shaftesbury Avenue and a car cut across me. 69 00:18:49,795 --> 00:18:53,549 Then I wake up today in hospital. I wake up and I'm... 70 00:18:53,633 --> 00:18:55,551 I'm hallucinating or I'm... 71 00:18:57,220 --> 00:18:59,680 What's your name? 72 00:18:59,764 --> 00:19:01,849 Jim. 73 00:19:02,517 --> 00:19:05,186 I'm Mark. This is Selena. 74 00:19:09,607 --> 00:19:11,275 OK, Jim. 75 00:19:16,489 --> 00:19:19,033 I've got some bad news. 76 00:19:19,116 --> 00:19:25,373 It started as rioting, and right from the beginning you knew this was different. 77 00:19:25,456 --> 00:19:29,627 Because it was happening in small villages, market towns. 78 00:19:30,503 --> 00:19:33,256 And then it wasn't on the TV any more. 79 00:19:33,339 --> 00:19:38,052 It was in the street outside. It was coming through your windows. 80 00:19:38,135 --> 00:19:39,971 It was a virus. 81 00:19:40,054 --> 00:19:41,848 An infection. 82 00:19:41,931 --> 00:19:44,767 You didn't need a doctor to tell you that. 83 00:19:44,851 --> 00:19:47,311 It was the blood. 84 00:19:47,395 --> 00:19:49,897 There was something in the blood. 85 00:19:51,357 --> 00:19:56,320 By the time they tried to evacuate the cities, it was already too late. 86 00:19:56,404 --> 00:19:59,323 The infection was everywhere. 87 00:19:59,407 --> 00:20:01,909 The army blockades were overrun. 88 00:20:03,452 --> 00:20:06,164 And that's when the exodus started. 89 00:20:07,540 --> 00:20:10,293 The day before broadcasting stopped, 90 00:20:10,376 --> 00:20:14,046 there were reports of Infection in Paris and New York. 91 00:20:16,424 --> 00:20:19,343 We didn't hear anything more after that. 92 00:20:22,305 --> 00:20:25,266 - What's the government doing? - There's no government. 93 00:20:25,349 --> 00:20:27,810 Of course there's a government! 94 00:20:27,894 --> 00:20:31,981 There's always a government. They're in a bunker or a plane... 95 00:20:32,064 --> 00:20:36,360 No, there's no government, no police, no army. 96 00:20:37,820 --> 00:20:40,907 No TV, no radio, no electricity. 97 00:20:41,532 --> 00:20:45,703 You're the first uninfected person we've seen in six days. 98 00:20:46,537 --> 00:20:48,623 Where's your family? 99 00:20:49,540 --> 00:20:51,584 They're dead. Like Selena's. 100 00:20:51,667 --> 00:20:53,794 Yours will be dead too. 101 00:21:04,096 --> 00:21:08,100 Look, I have to find them. They live in Deptford. I can walk it. OK? 102 00:21:08,184 --> 00:21:10,770 You'll go and come back, yeah? 103 00:21:12,730 --> 00:21:14,982 - You won't. - Yes! 104 00:21:15,066 --> 00:21:18,069 No one ever comes back. 105 00:21:22,573 --> 00:21:24,659 So lesson one. 106 00:21:25,535 --> 00:21:29,956 You never go anywhere alone unless you've got no choice. 107 00:21:30,039 --> 00:21:32,375 Lesson two. 108 00:21:32,458 --> 00:21:36,546 Only travel during daylight. Unless you've got no choice. 109 00:21:38,589 --> 00:21:40,633 We'll take you tomorrow. 110 00:21:40,716 --> 00:21:44,303 We'll all go and find your dead parents together, OK? 111 00:21:45,346 --> 00:21:46,806 Eat. 112 00:21:58,985 --> 00:22:02,154 If you want her to slow down, you'll have to say. 113 00:22:29,056 --> 00:22:30,725 - If there's anyone... - I understand. 114 00:22:30,808 --> 00:22:32,894 - Anyone... - I understand! 115 00:22:35,021 --> 00:22:36,564 OK. 116 00:23:09,931 --> 00:23:11,933 (sniffs) 117 00:23:18,356 --> 00:23:19,690 Jim... 118 00:23:20,525 --> 00:23:21,859 Wait! 119 00:24:46,527 --> 00:24:50,489 They died peacefully. You should be grateful. 120 00:24:50,573 --> 00:24:52,992 I'm not grateful. 121 00:24:54,243 --> 00:24:56,245 My... 122 00:24:56,954 --> 00:25:01,459 parents and my sister, we went to Paddington Station, 123 00:25:04,086 --> 00:25:09,425 hoping maybe we could get on a plane, maybe we could buy our way onto a plane. 124 00:25:10,051 --> 00:25:12,428 I remember my dad had all this cash, 125 00:25:12,512 --> 00:25:15,848 even though cash was completely useless. 126 00:25:17,391 --> 00:25:20,520 About 20,000 other people had the same idea. 127 00:25:23,022 --> 00:25:25,233 Crowd was surging. 128 00:25:26,067 --> 00:25:28,402 I lost my grip on my sister's hand. 129 00:25:30,571 --> 00:25:32,907 I remember the ground was soft. 130 00:25:34,867 --> 00:25:39,247 I looked down and I was standing on all these people. 131 00:25:39,330 --> 00:25:43,292 Like a carpet. People who had fallen and... 132 00:25:43,376 --> 00:25:47,338 Somewhere in the crowd there were Infected. It spread fast. 133 00:25:47,421 --> 00:25:50,758 No one could run. All you could do was climb. 134 00:25:52,385 --> 00:25:55,471 Climb over more people. So I did that. I climbed. 135 00:25:55,555 --> 00:25:57,932 And I got up on top of this kiosk. 136 00:26:00,226 --> 00:26:05,189 Looking down, you couldn't tell which faces were infected and which weren't. 137 00:26:05,273 --> 00:26:09,151 Then I saw my dad. Not my mum or my sister. 138 00:26:09,235 --> 00:26:11,195 My dad. 139 00:26:13,489 --> 00:26:15,575 His face... 140 00:26:19,245 --> 00:26:23,166 Selena's right. You should be grateful. 141 00:26:23,249 --> 00:26:28,421 We don't have time to get back to the shop before dark. We should stay here tonight. 142 00:26:31,090 --> 00:26:33,926 My room's up at the top. You two can have that. 143 00:26:34,010 --> 00:26:37,346 No, we'll all sleep in the same room. It's safer. 144 00:27:51,838 --> 00:27:54,215 (radio) 145 00:27:57,635 --> 00:27:59,720 Jim. 146 00:28:08,396 --> 00:28:10,481 - You're back. - Yeah. 147 00:28:16,863 --> 00:28:18,948 - How was it? - Fine. 148 00:28:20,032 --> 00:28:22,326 Give me a drink of that, will ya? 149 00:28:22,410 --> 00:28:24,495 - It's empty. - Ha! 150 00:28:26,789 --> 00:28:29,125 Here. 151 00:28:31,210 --> 00:28:33,296 I'll start working on them, then. 152 00:28:39,927 --> 00:28:41,929 Mark! Mark! 153 00:28:42,722 --> 00:28:44,849 Selena! Help! 154 00:28:59,197 --> 00:29:01,282 (Selena) It's clear. 155 00:29:06,746 --> 00:29:09,707 - That's Mr Bridges. - Were you bitten? 156 00:29:09,790 --> 00:29:12,001 And his daughter. From four doors down. 157 00:29:12,084 --> 00:29:15,171 - Were you bitten? - No. 158 00:29:15,254 --> 00:29:18,174 Did any of the blood get in your mouth? 159 00:29:19,091 --> 00:29:21,093 No. 160 00:29:24,222 --> 00:29:25,973 Mark? 161 00:29:28,392 --> 00:29:30,102 Wait... 162 00:29:32,104 --> 00:29:34,482 (Mark screams) 163 00:29:51,958 --> 00:29:54,168 Get that cleaned off. 164 00:29:56,045 --> 00:29:58,130 Do you have any clothes here? 165 00:29:59,257 --> 00:30:01,133 Um... I... Yes. 166 00:30:01,217 --> 00:30:04,887 Then get them and get dressed. We have to leave now. 167 00:30:04,971 --> 00:30:08,641 More Infected will be coming. They always do. 168 00:30:37,420 --> 00:30:40,423 (Jim) How did you know? How did you know he was infected? 169 00:30:40,506 --> 00:30:44,427 - The blood. - There was blood on me. It was on you. 170 00:30:44,510 --> 00:30:49,891 I didn't know he was infected. He knew. I could see it in his face. 171 00:30:49,974 --> 00:30:54,395 If someone gets infected, you've about 20 seconds to kill them. 172 00:30:54,478 --> 00:30:59,609 It might be your brother, your sister or your oldest friend. It makes no difference. 173 00:30:59,692 --> 00:31:05,114 Just so you know where you stand, if it happens to you, I'll do it in a heartbeat. 174 00:31:05,198 --> 00:31:09,410 He was full of plans. Have you got any plans, Jim? 175 00:31:09,494 --> 00:31:13,956 Do you want us to find a cure and save the world orjust fall in love and fuck? 176 00:31:14,040 --> 00:31:16,542 Plans are pointless. 177 00:31:16,626 --> 00:31:19,212 Staying alive's as good as it gets. 178 00:31:21,047 --> 00:31:22,465 Hey, hey, hey, hey. 179 00:31:22,548 --> 00:31:24,634 What's that? 180 00:31:30,723 --> 00:31:32,808 Let's go. 181 00:32:17,937 --> 00:32:21,065 What is it about tower blocks and shopping trolleys? 182 00:32:21,148 --> 00:32:24,235 Stop talking. It's a long way up. 183 00:32:33,953 --> 00:32:36,289 (Selena) Do you need a break? 184 00:32:37,498 --> 00:32:39,500 - You? - No. 185 00:32:42,170 --> 00:32:44,255 Now I do need a break. 186 00:32:54,724 --> 00:32:56,559 What's up? 187 00:32:56,642 --> 00:32:58,644 Nothin'. 188 00:33:01,022 --> 00:33:02,356 I got a headache. 189 00:33:02,440 --> 00:33:03,941 - Bad? - Pretty bad. 190 00:33:04,025 --> 00:33:09,322 - Why didn't you say something before? - I didn't think you'd give a shit. 191 00:33:10,531 --> 00:33:14,785 You've got no fat on you and all you've had to eat is sugar. 192 00:33:14,869 --> 00:33:16,996 So you're crashing. 193 00:33:17,079 --> 00:33:19,332 There isn't a lot we can do about that 194 00:33:19,415 --> 00:33:24,504 except pump you full of painkillers and give you more sugar. As for sugar, 195 00:33:24,587 --> 00:33:26,881 Pepsi or Lilt? 196 00:33:28,132 --> 00:33:30,134 Do you have any Tango? 197 00:33:30,218 --> 00:33:33,262 Actually, I did have a can of Tango somewhere. 198 00:33:33,346 --> 00:33:34,388 (screech) 199 00:33:34,472 --> 00:33:36,724 Quiet! That's an Infected. 200 00:33:47,068 --> 00:33:48,903 Oh no, they're in. Move! 201 00:33:51,989 --> 00:33:54,534 Wait up, Selena! 202 00:33:55,451 --> 00:33:57,453 Wait for me, please! 203 00:33:57,537 --> 00:33:59,664 Please, Selena! Please! 204 00:33:59,747 --> 00:34:02,083 - Wait for me! - Come on! 205 00:34:02,166 --> 00:34:04,168 - Run! - Wait! 206 00:34:04,794 --> 00:34:07,505 Please! For fuck's sake! 207 00:34:08,089 --> 00:34:10,341 - Selena! - (screams) 208 00:34:12,051 --> 00:34:15,429 Down the corridor. Flat 157. Move! 209 00:34:15,513 --> 00:34:17,598 Thank you. Thank you. 210 00:34:30,069 --> 00:34:32,113 Open the door! 211 00:34:37,702 --> 00:34:39,287 Open the door! 212 00:34:44,000 --> 00:34:46,502 - Open up! - Where's Dad? 213 00:34:46,586 --> 00:34:48,045 What? 214 00:34:50,631 --> 00:34:53,634 - Open the fucking door! - Where's Dad? 215 00:34:53,718 --> 00:34:56,012 Let them in, Hannah. Let them inside. 216 00:35:03,936 --> 00:35:06,230 Go in. Go in! 217 00:35:07,857 --> 00:35:10,902 ("Frosty the Snowman") 218 00:35:24,248 --> 00:35:26,709 So, I'm Frank, anyway. 219 00:35:26,792 --> 00:35:28,586 Jim. 220 00:35:29,420 --> 00:35:32,507 - Selena. - Selena. Good to meet you. 221 00:35:32,590 --> 00:35:34,884 This is my daughter Hannah. 222 00:35:34,967 --> 00:35:37,220 Come on, sweetheart. Say hello. 223 00:35:38,638 --> 00:35:40,723 Come on. 224 00:35:41,474 --> 00:35:43,434 So... 225 00:35:43,518 --> 00:35:45,436 This is great. Just great. 226 00:35:47,772 --> 00:35:50,066 Calls for a celebration, I'd say. 227 00:35:50,149 --> 00:35:53,194 Why don't you all sit down and... 228 00:35:53,277 --> 00:35:56,239 Hannah, what have we got to offer? 229 00:35:56,322 --> 00:35:58,825 We've got Mum's crème de menthe. 230 00:35:58,908 --> 00:36:01,619 Great. Crème de menthe. 231 00:36:01,702 --> 00:36:04,413 Oh, yeah. Look, sit, please. 232 00:36:04,497 --> 00:36:06,958 Get comfortable. 233 00:36:09,794 --> 00:36:12,797 - (Frank) Where are the bloody glasses? - Middle cupboard. 234 00:36:12,880 --> 00:36:15,758 Nah, the good ones. It's a celebration. 235 00:36:15,842 --> 00:36:18,344 Top cupboard. 236 00:36:18,427 --> 00:36:21,138 So this is your place? 237 00:36:22,390 --> 00:36:24,141 It's nice. 238 00:36:37,321 --> 00:36:38,447 There. 239 00:36:38,531 --> 00:36:41,617 I know it isn't much but, well, cheers. 240 00:36:41,701 --> 00:36:43,452 Cheers. 241 00:36:58,301 --> 00:37:00,303 (groans) 242 00:37:04,974 --> 00:37:07,059 You OK in there, Jim? 243 00:37:08,019 --> 00:37:10,354 Yeah. 244 00:37:10,438 --> 00:37:16,027 Sorry we couldn't spare the water. Same with the toilet. The flush doesn't work. 245 00:37:17,695 --> 00:37:19,947 You'll have to use the bucket. 246 00:37:26,496 --> 00:37:29,123 Have to empty it each morning. 247 00:37:29,207 --> 00:37:32,877 Just chuck it over the balcony. No mod cons here. 248 00:37:32,960 --> 00:37:34,670 It's fine. 249 00:37:34,754 --> 00:37:37,882 Listen, it's late. We're gonna turn in. 250 00:37:39,550 --> 00:37:41,928 We have a spare room. 251 00:37:42,970 --> 00:37:44,263 In there. 252 00:37:44,347 --> 00:37:46,307 Are you and Selena...? 253 00:37:47,558 --> 00:37:49,393 No. No, no, no. 254 00:37:49,477 --> 00:37:51,145 Um... 255 00:37:51,229 --> 00:37:53,606 I'll take the living room. It's fine. 256 00:37:53,689 --> 00:37:55,566 Right. 257 00:37:56,442 --> 00:37:58,528 No, I mean, yeah. 258 00:37:59,570 --> 00:38:01,572 So, um... 259 00:38:02,615 --> 00:38:05,618 - Goodnight, then. - Yeah. Goodnight, Frank. 260 00:38:20,258 --> 00:38:21,801 Very spruce. 261 00:38:23,135 --> 00:38:25,972 - Very shredded. - Yeah. 262 00:38:30,309 --> 00:38:34,021 - So what do you make of them? - Well, they're desperate. 263 00:38:35,147 --> 00:38:37,984 Probably need us more than we need them. 264 00:38:39,443 --> 00:38:41,696 I think they're good people. 265 00:38:44,532 --> 00:38:47,493 - Good people? - Yeah. 266 00:38:49,287 --> 00:38:53,958 You should be more concerned about whether they're gonna slow you down. 267 00:38:54,041 --> 00:38:57,795 - Because if they slowed you down... - I'd leave them behind. 268 00:38:57,879 --> 00:38:59,797 - In a heartbeat. - Yeah. 269 00:39:00,506 --> 00:39:02,175 I wouldn't. 270 00:39:02,258 --> 00:39:05,803 Then you're gonna wind up getting yourself killed. 271 00:39:14,145 --> 00:39:16,647 I'm gonna get some sleep. 272 00:39:19,150 --> 00:39:21,027 Selena... 273 00:39:21,861 --> 00:39:25,114 You think I don't get it, but I do get it. 274 00:39:26,991 --> 00:39:30,995 And I know I'd be dead already if I hadn't met you. 275 00:39:31,496 --> 00:39:33,080 Sure. 276 00:39:33,164 --> 00:39:34,749 No, look... 277 00:39:37,126 --> 00:39:39,212 I mean, thank you. 278 00:39:42,381 --> 00:39:44,550 And I mean, sure. 279 00:39:44,634 --> 00:39:47,428 Goodnight, Jim. 280 00:39:47,512 --> 00:39:49,597 Goodnight. 281 00:40:03,194 --> 00:40:05,279 We lost water pressure three weeks ago. 282 00:40:05,363 --> 00:40:09,492 I thought we'd be OK with the water from the other flats. Cisterns and tanks. 283 00:40:09,575 --> 00:40:12,787 But it vanishes so quick you wouldn't believe. 284 00:40:16,082 --> 00:40:17,792 You drink it, 285 00:40:17,875 --> 00:40:19,669 it evaporates, 286 00:40:19,752 --> 00:40:21,838 turns stagnant. 287 00:40:24,215 --> 00:40:26,300 They're all empty. 288 00:40:27,176 --> 00:40:29,178 Hasn't rained in ten days. 289 00:40:29,262 --> 00:40:33,516 You can set up a plastic sheet to catch dew and condensation. 290 00:40:33,599 --> 00:40:37,353 Saw it on TV once, but I can't make it work. 291 00:40:38,688 --> 00:40:40,773 You'd never think it. 292 00:40:41,691 --> 00:40:44,652 Needing rain so badly. 293 00:40:46,320 --> 00:40:48,739 Not in fucking England! 294 00:40:53,411 --> 00:40:56,539 Jim, we're not going to be able to stay here. 295 00:41:05,464 --> 00:41:09,218 - There's been no broadcasts for weeks. - Just listen. 296 00:41:09,302 --> 00:41:13,890 (man on radio) Salvation is here. The answer to Infection is here. 297 00:41:13,973 --> 00:41:16,976 If you can hear this, you're not alone. 298 00:41:17,059 --> 00:41:21,564 There are others like you. There are other survivors. 299 00:41:21,647 --> 00:41:23,858 We are soldiers and we are armed. 300 00:41:23,941 --> 00:41:27,236 Oh, my God. Soldiers. 301 00:41:27,320 --> 00:41:31,908 - Quiet. There's more. - Our location is the 42nd blockade, M602, 302 00:41:31,991 --> 00:41:35,411 27 miles northeast of Manchester. 303 00:41:35,495 --> 00:41:39,415 - You must find us. Salvation is... - Now it just repeats. 304 00:41:39,499 --> 00:41:41,876 - It's a recording? - Yeah, it's a recording. 305 00:41:41,959 --> 00:41:44,879 But this is where it's telling us to go. 306 00:41:44,962 --> 00:41:47,131 Just there. 307 00:41:48,633 --> 00:41:53,429 The way things are, we might need two or three days to get up there. 308 00:41:53,513 --> 00:41:55,223 "We"? 309 00:41:59,310 --> 00:42:05,399 Sound carries in this flat. Me and Hannah do need you more than you need us. 310 00:42:05,483 --> 00:42:08,653 - Look, I didn't... - No, it's OK. It's the truth. 311 00:42:08,736 --> 00:42:11,239 I can't leave the block if it's the two of us. 312 00:42:11,322 --> 00:42:15,284 Something might happen to me. Hannah'd be alone. I couldn't risk it. 313 00:42:15,368 --> 00:42:17,078 But with other people... 314 00:42:17,161 --> 00:42:21,457 If it's a recording, the soldiers who made it could be dead. 315 00:42:21,541 --> 00:42:25,044 - It's possible. - That stuff about the answer to Infection... 316 00:42:25,127 --> 00:42:29,423 There is no answer! It's already done all the damage it can! 317 00:42:29,507 --> 00:42:32,343 - Maybe they have a cure. - Maybe they've got nothing. 318 00:42:32,426 --> 00:42:36,514 - The only way to find out is to reach them. - We could die trying, Frank! 319 00:42:38,599 --> 00:42:40,893 Or die here. 320 00:42:40,977 --> 00:42:46,691 And anyway, it isn't true what Dad said.
